column4: that doesn't work.. have you looked at a xorg.conf in 9.10 ??  it's basically empty
not mine, i have a gts250 and my /etc/X11/xorg.conf is a mile long grubnoob <
did you install the binary driver for your nvidia?  there is a "write to xorg" option at the end of the install... when that happens xorg overrides xrandr and "other" stuff.
yes Im using the latest binary. I used nvidia-settings to make my xorg.conf, and had to go in and edit a few things by hand to get dual head working.
